Prblems loading Trillian and problems trying to get onto Spectrasonics website

Hi

Recently purchased the upgrade for my Trilogy, Trillian.

First problem was on installation it would not find and would not allow me to direct it to my already installed STEAM directory (I have Omnisphere).

So tried to install it where it wanted to install the STEAM directory anyway and it took forever to install. And of course it did not work.

Anyone else had this problem - I'm thinking my discs may be faulty as the loading of each DVD took probably 30+ minutes.

Then to top it all the Spectrasonics website appears to be down.

Anyone else had these problems? Would like to know before I try and return the discs for replacements etc

Cheers

Nigel

Nigel

Joined:

Re:Prblems loading Trillian and problems trying to get onto Spectrasonics website (permalink)

First, your disks are not faulty. On a "regular ol" dvd drive it takes about that long per disk. Sorry you can't get into the site as they have step by step video tutorials on how to make sure you install into the STEAM directory properly. Come to think of it there should be those same tutorials somewhere on one of your Trilian install DVDs. Take a look. It can be confusing, but once you get your sample library in the STEAM folder correctly....it will be AWESOME! I think many times that folks (I did this once) create an "extra" folder they don't need to when trying to install into the STEAM folder. Look for those tutorials.

https://soundcloud.com/doghouse-riley/tracks

https://doghouseriley1.bandcamp.com

Where you come from is gone...where you thought you were goin to weren't never there...and where you are ain't no good unless you can get away from it.

SPLAT 64 bit running on a Studio Cat Pro System Win 10 64bit 2.8ghz Core i7 with 24 gigs ram. MOTU Audio Express.

ston

Max Output Level: -71 dBFS

Total Posts : 965

Joined:

Status: offline

Re:Prblems loading Trillian and problems trying to get onto Spectrasonics website (permalink)

It does take forever to install; it's having to unpack about 35GB from archives across 5 DVDs! 30 minutes for each disc sounds about right.

I don't know whether the installer behaves differently if there is an existing STEAM directory (I don't have Omnisphere installed), but I do remember the installer allowing me to chose the path to the STEAM folder.

I've just tried the Spectrasonics account link:

http://auth.spectrasonics.net/useracct/

...and it's working fine. The main Spectrasonics website page is also up.

Bajan Blue

Max Output Level: -55 dBFS

Total Posts : 2029

Joined:

Location: Barbados & Cape Town

Status: offline

Re:Prblems loading Trillian and problems trying to get onto Spectrasonics website (permalink)

Hi

Thanks for the replies - I actually got onto the site as well today, so I think it must have just been down over the weekend – also eventually managed to load Trillian – still could not get it to load into the already existing STEAM directory as the installations instructions said I should; it set up a completely new and independent STEAM directory – on the same hard disc just a different location.

But all seems to work OK so I decided to leave it and see what happens.

Thanks again

Nigel
